title: When torch.symeig or torch.svb works on GPU, why it still occupies a lot of CPU? Is it a bug or not?
body_html:
The code are D, V = torch.symeig(input1, eigenvectors=True ), U, D, V = torch.svb(input2). The input1 and input2 are all torch.cuda.FloatTensor type. When I test it on GPU , they still occupy a lot of GPU.
But when I try D= torch.symeig(input1 ) on the GPU, it didn't occupy CPU. Could you give me some advices?
